intro: Wahlenbergia annua, commonly known as the annual bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and prefers well-drained soils. It blooms during the summer months and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. The leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
